content.description: start on predator, after first roof, veer up and left of predator roof
content.location: left of predator

content.description: Starts just right of flying snakes. Climb face through shallow corner and steep headwall on big flakes. Pumpy hand traverse at top makes for an exciting finish.
content.location: right side of main wall

content.description: fun long slab
content.location: Left side of Cove behind bi boulder and right of Flumetastic.

content.description: Powerful arete to face.
content.location: right side of cove

climbs.name: Predator
climbs.fa: todd worsfold, mike carville, josh horniak

content.description: Crux is turning lip of roof just below belay anchors.
content.location: center of wall through obvious small roof

content.description:
Project abandoned by Chris Miller circa 2000. I contacted him and he gave permission for the open project.

4 white painted bolts lead to a ledge and steep dirty overhangs with loose rock. Would require extensive cleaning.

Rating is a guess may be harder through the overhangs.
content.location: Right of Long Shot
Left of Long Shot / chimney

content.description: face climbing on blocky holds, leads to fun edge climbing on upper face.
content.location: 25 feet right of chimney left side of main wall.

content.description: LOL is the route right next to Bolting Ban. It is a short, 20-foot climb that can double as a nice highball boulder problem if you are willing to do it. It is easier than Bolting Ban, but can still be a challenge for boulderers. It can be easily toproped, but there are no bolts and minimal possible trad pro, so it can't be leaded.
content.protection: Toprope or crash pad, depending on how you want to climb it.
content.location: On the west boulder, easily found due to the fact you have to get very close to it, bottom and top, to get to climbs like Pulp Friction.

content.description: fun climbing on steepish face to corner through roof
content.location: just right of big low angle corner

content.description: super fun, steep climbing on good holds with big pulls, fixed draws
Tricky moves off ground through big roof.  Stellar crack and face climbing above leads to anchors.
content.location: right of center

climbs.name: Flumetastic Voyage
climbs.fa: Charles Cole, Chris Miller & Lisa Guindon, June 2000

content.description: Insecure start with a poor landing. You may actually end up in the water if you botch the first clip (stick-clip useful). This climb was bolted ground up and has some 30' runouts between bolts albeit on easyish terrain. Not a beginner lead. Need a 70m rope.
content.protection: 6 bolts painted white to a 2 bolt anchor with closed shuts (gated).
content.location: Left side of the flume across the water from Flumetastic. Shares anchors with Flume with a View 5.7 to the right.

content.description: Need a 70 meter rope. Steepish face leads to long fun slab.
content.location: Left most route (above flume tunnel) behind big boulder left side of The Cove.

climbs.name: Flume with a View
climbs.fa: Chris Miller, Charles Cole & Lisa Guindon, June 2000

content.description: Shares the same insecure start with Flumetastic Voyage to the left. If you botch the first clip you very well may end up in the water (stick-clip useful). Traverse right to a small roof then up a dirty slab with runouts on dirty easy terrain up high. Need a 70m rope.
content.protection: 8 bolts painted white to a 2-bolt anchor with closed shuts (gated).
content.location: Left side of the flume across the water from Flumetastic. Shares anchors with the Flumetastic Voyage to the left.

content.description: climb thorough left side of big roof low on route. continue on fun face moves through roofy bluge and tricky finish to anchors.
content.location: center of main wall

content.description: Josh Horniak's book says "5.11 b 4 bolts.  Bolt anchor.  WO.  A short, fingery climb on the north side of the East Boulder."  Felt much harder than 11b, more like 11d.
content.location: North side of the East Boulder.

content.description: A testy start for the guidebook 5.9 rating involving a sharp crimp but it is generally juggy fun thereafter. It would be interesting to see some consensus on the grade of this short diversion.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a two bolt anchor with a couple links each
content.location: The southwest side of the East Boulder right by the corridor leading to Flumetastic and Pulp Friction, adjacent to Bat Company.

content.description: Bolting Ban is a short route. It is easy to toprope, and could double as a highball boulder problem if you are willing to do it that way. There are no bolts, hence the name.
content.protection: Toprope or crash pad, depends on how you climb this route.
content.location: On the West Boulder, easily spotted due to the fact that you have to climb near the top of it to reach climbs like Pulp Friction.

content.description:
Access route/rap route for the Upper Cove wall.

**NOTE***: 70m rope is REQUIRED if you intend to rappel this route. Be certain to tie knots in the ends of the rope as well, it barely makes it down. When throwing your rope, for best results, throw it towards the flume building.

Start just behind the Fir tree, just to the right of the "Clock Tower" boulder.head up the ramp and onto the face towards the roof. Pull the roof on giant holds and continue up the buttress to the giant belay ledge. From here belay up your second and scramble to the Upper Cove wall, or Rap/TR. Use the giant boulder above as a landmark for getting back to the ledge.
content.protection: Now sporting 11 bolts. Some extenders might be nice but not needed.
content.location: Right side of the Clock Tower Boulder, behind big Fir Tree.

content.protection: 11 bolts to a 2-bolt anchor with chains. You can access the anchors for TR if you hike around the right side of the cove and go up a climbers trail to a ledge system and traverse north to a large pine and rap into the anchors. There are other anchors for different projects but only one has lead bolts.
content.location: On the far right of the cove area. Cross the bridge and turn immediately right (south) and walk for a couple hundred feet to access the trail to the wall. Route starts just north of a large dead fir tree and right of a large left-facing dirty corner.

content.description: Part of the West Boulder.  Toprope anchors can be set from the top.
content.location: Bolder between Pulp Friction and Clockworks.
